de.bpmnaftool.model.aristaflow.graph.edge
Interface Edge

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEdge, ControlEdge, EdgeImpl, LoopEdge, SyncEdge
public interface Edge

Abstract representation of a directed edge. Instead of using this generalized edge, the specialized sub-types should be used. The purpose of this interface is to define methods which are needed for all types of edges. It is not possible to create an instance of this class (protected constructor) - use the subclasses instead.

Author:
Felix Härer

getDestinationNode

Node getDestinationNode()
Retrieves the destination node where the edge is incoming

Returns:
Node destination node

getEdgeCode

java.lang.Integer getEdgeCode()
Retrieves the edge code. It is used if other edges have the same sourceNodeId. For all edges with the same source node, the edgeCode must be unique. Edges are numbered with the edgeCode in sequence starting from 0.

Returns:
edge code, at least 0. Null if no edge code is set.

setEdgeCode

void setEdgeCode(int edgeCode)
Sets an edge code. It is used if other edges have the same sourceNodeId. For all edges with the same source node, the edgeCode must be unique. Edges are numbered with the edgeCode in sequence starting from 0.

Parameters:
edgeCode -

getEdgeType

java.lang.String getEdgeType()
Retrieves the type of the edge in a string. This should not be used for checking the type of an edge, the keyword instanceof can be used instead.

Returns:
type of edge as string
